question.text: The arrangement of heart valves from the right to the left side is

options.text: Tricuspid valve - Bicuspid valve - Pulmonary semilunar valve - Aortic Semilunar valve
Tricuspid valve - Pulmonary semilunar valve - Bicuspid valve - Aortic Semilunar valve
Tricuspid valve - Aortic Semilunar valve - Bicuspid valve - Pulmonary semilunar valve
Tricuspid valve - Pulmonary semilunar valve - Aortic Semilunar valve - Bicuspid valve

solution.text:
Double circulation in mammalian heart is as follows:

Superior and inferior vena cava bring deoxygenated blood → right auricle → right ventricle → pulmonary artery → lungs → pulmonary vein → left auricle → left ventricle → aorta → body.
The valves present are tricuspid (between right auricle and ventricle), pulmonary semilunar valve (between right ventricle and pulmonary artery), bicuspid valve between left auricle and ventricle and aortic valve between left ventricle and aorta. In the anatomy of the heart the aortic valve is on the right side of bicuspid valve.
